newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee jumps after Vietnam report.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee jumps after Vietnam report.

text.p: LIFFE robusta coffee futures, already buoyed by fund buying, jumped in late trade following news that Vietnam will consider joining the Association of Coffee Producing and Exporting Countries.
Technically-inspired fund buying made coffee firm earlier in the day, but the Vietnam news caused a sharp jump.
Most active May rose by $53 to $1,380 on volume of 4,825 lots. March rose $33 to $1,380 on volume of 3,200 lots. Total volume was 9,152 lots.
The rise put March at its highest level since November 21.
"London has been undervalued for some time, but it's a bit overdone at the moment," one trader said of the rise.
He felt that now would be the easiest time for Vietnam to join, with most of its crop already sold.
Vietnam supports the Association of Coffee Producing Countries (ACPC) and will consider joining the coffee producers group, said the Ivorian Minister for Commodities Guy-Alain Gauze.
"Vietnam has expressed its support for the ACPC and said it will consider at a government level joining the ACPC," Gauze told Reuters in a telephone interview.
